oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tompall Glaser Interview by Bob Allen Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Tompall Glaser being interviewed by Bob Allen. The interview takes place on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tompall Glaser
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side Two - (0:01) --Tompall Glaser explains that playing music is an obsession to pass the time. (0:34) -- Tompall Glaser mentions Jimmy Bowen being crucial to the future of Nashville. (1:27) -- Tompall Glaser mentions the importance of "Gentle On My Mind." Tompall Glaser goes on to describe his desire for new country art to be created. (2:26) -- "When we did this pinball thing, we did it to piss people off." - Tompall Glaser. Tompall mentions spending $70,000 in one year. (2:42) -- "Do what you do, only just keep doing it boldly." - Tompall Glaser. (3:54) -- Interview cuts to Tompall Glaser ordering drinks at a bar. (6:12) -- Bob Allen asks Tompall Glaser about publishing in New Orleans.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Glaser, Tompall;
